name: Circuit courts have jurisdiction
text:
The circuit courts shall try and determine all actions arising under this part, subject only to an appeal in accordance with law.  The court, on its own motion or on motion of any party, may try and determine any issue in the case in advance of other issues. [L 1896, c 45, §5; RL 1925, §813; RL 1935, §55; RL 1945, §306; am L 1947, c 200, §1(a); RL 1955, §8-9; HRS ; am L 2004, c 202, §9]
 
Note
 
  L 2004, c 202, §82 provides:
  "SECTION 82.  Appeals pending in the supreme court as of the effective date of this Act [July 1, 2006] may be transferred to the intermediate appellate court or retained at the supreme court as the chief justice, in the chief justice's sole discretion, directs."
 
Case Notes
 
  Cited:  20 H. 365, 367; 30 H. 1, 5; 39 H. 53, 57.
